ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, I will not hesitate to recommend this course to students who are interested in studying the Dead Sea Scrolls and its interpretations of Scriptural texts.

A thorough treatment of 4QMMT that seeks to address new and old questions about the sectarian document. It approaches the document through various perspectives in order to understand the broad range of its interpreted meanings. An excellent course and yes, it is recommended.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I could learn from the course that there were many other books that the scrolls writers regarded as authorities and cited in their compositions.Among some scrolls, they show the differences of the biblical interpretation. In the class, we could find that many cases in which the scrolls authors quote or alldue to Scripture demonstrate that they placed some books on the higher level.This is really such a great course.

Numerous ways, more than I am able to write. Most importantly, however, it has helped broaden my own understanding of one type of Second Temple Judaism and allowed me to further connect its ideas with others found during the same era.
